intro: Palicourea breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered palicourea, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, elliptical berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
